iplb_frontends_intro_text: The Frontend is the part of your Load Balancer that make your services visible on the internet.
iplb_frontend_list_error: An error has occurred loading the list of front-facing services.
iplb_frontend_update_error: An error has occurred modifying the following front-facing service: {{message}}
iplb_frontend_update_success: The front-facing service has been successfully modified.
iplb_frontend_add_error: An error has occurred adding a front-facing service: {{message}}
iplb_frontend_add_success: The front-facing service has been successfully created.
iplb_frontend_add_port_tip: Ports presented by the frontend. 1 to {{portMax}}, format: single (e.g.: 80), range (e.g.: 1000-1200), multi (e.g.: 80,443).
iplb_frontend_add_farm_text: Once this front-facing service has been created, you can add a server cluster to it directly by default.
iplb_frontend_add_default_certificate_te: Unable to add a new certificate directly. You can add it once your front-facing service has been successfully created.
iplb_frontend_add_advanced_options_info: The most recent default values have been pre-set. You can modify them at any time.
iplb_frontend_add_dedicated_ip_failover_: List of IP addresses for remote servers connected to your load balancing IP.
iplb_frontend_add_restrict_ip_access_tip: List of customer IP adresses that have access to the Load Balancing IP (IPv4). Format: 1.2.3.4, 42.42.42.0/24
iplb_frontend_add_hsts_tip: Activate https strict support, HTTP Strict Transport Security
iplb_frontend_delete_question: Are you sure you want to delete the following front facing service: {{frontend}}?
iplb_frontend_delete_error: An error has occurred deleting the front-facing service: {{message}}
iplb_frontend_delete_success: The front-facing service has been successfully deleted.
iplb_frontend_toggle_success: The front-facing service has been successfully modified.
iplb_frontend_toggle_error: An error has occurred editing the front-facing service: {{message}}
